intro: Coleosanthus scaber, commonly known as the rough-leaved corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its rough, scabrous leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Coleosanthus scaber is often found in coastal regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
